The first Monday in May is the biggest date in any fashionista’s diary.The opening of the Costume Institute’s annual fashion exhibition in New York is a chance for the biggest names in the business to get glammed up on another level than your regular red carpet events.This year, Met Gala attendees paid homage to the late Karl Lagerfeld, and as ever, there were some super bold moments (Jared Leto dressed as Choupette the cat, we’re looking at you).

But there was plenty to take with us into our own everyday wardrobes too. You don’t have to ascend the iconic steps of the Met yourself to get the look!We weren’t surprised to see a lot of monochrome, but white dresses really did seem to be the way to go.Classic Karl icons such as pearls and camelias were incorporated by Kim Kardashian, Emily Blunt and Rihanna.

Boucle will always be synonymous with Chanel, so Anne Hathaway has to be up there with our favourites too.With these leading ladies in mind, not only have we’ve tracked down 10 of the best head-turning dresses, including Chanel-esque high street finds to give your Bank Holiday Monday a bit of Met Gala glamour...Get the Met Gala look   Boohoo Sequin Split Cuff Power Shoulder Shirt Dress  Kendall Jenner was a vision in sequins at the Met Gala.
